abstract: The Bank of America filed an appeal with the Dutch Supreme Court on Tuesday over a ruling this month that froze the company’s $21 billion purchase of the LaSalle Bank from ABN Amro. “We’re confident that the Dutch Supreme Court, when presented with all the facts, will overturn the decision” of the Amsterdam Superior Court, Scott Silvestri, a Bank of America spokesman, told The Associated Press.
lead_paragraph: The Bank of America filed an appeal with the Dutch Supreme Court on Tuesday over a ruling this month that froze the company’s $21 billion purchase of the LaSalle Bank from ABN Amro. “We’re confident that the Dutch Supreme Court, when presented with all the facts, will overturn the decision” of the Amsterdam Superior Court, Scott Silvestri, a Bank of America spokesman, told The Associated Press.

headline.main: BofA Appeals Dutch Ruling on LaSalle Sale
